subject: Investing
title: The Yield Curve Explained
description: One-minute skill: The Yield Curve Explained.

hook.text: Plot Treasury yields by maturity and you get the yield curve. Its shape predicts recessions better than most economists.

buildup.text: Normally, long-term bonds yield more than short-term ones. Locking up money longer deserves higher compensation.

discovery.text: When short-term yields exceed long-term yields, the curve inverts. It has preceded every US recession since 1970.

twist.text: An inverted curve doesn't cause recessions. It reflects market expectations that the economy will weaken.

climax.text: The curve inverted in 2022 and stayed inverted for over a year. Markets debated whether history would repeat.

punchline.text: The yield curve is the bond market's mood ring. Inversion means worry.

quiz.question: What does an inverted yield curve historically signal?
